attributes.action: stop Human Rights legislation inducing payments to criminals: (A) for wrongfully perceived enforced drug withdrawal, (B) for wrongfully perceived torture due to the blockade of an illicit substance, (C) for enabling an illegal act (drug taking) to receive a fiduciary payment from the taxpayer and indirectly – the victim of their crime.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Any victim of crime will feel incensed by legislation that allows the perpetrators of crime to be financially rewarded for wrong doing. This recent judgement enrages the law abiding citizen like me – particularly as I was assaulted in my last year at university. I later discovered that I have what is known as “acquired dyslexia” as a result of the injuries I received as a victim of crime. Despite being a graduate since 1998, I have never found employment that will provide a bridge to my potential. The statute of limitation is up and there is no way of getting recourse.
